source: Title: 星洲炒米粉, Ingredients: 3卷星洲炒米专用米粉 1520只鲜虾 大半个洋葱 一小根胡萝卜 35个青椒 1大根火腿肠 适量蒜末大葱段干辣椒 适量咖喱粉 适量盐 适量食用油 适量蚝油, Steps: 以上是所需要的食材 一定要用到咖喱粉，一般超市都买得到，不能用咖喱块代替 米粉我是在网上买的专门做星洲炒米的粉，这种粉比一般的粉丝有弹性也韧一些，炒的时候没那么容易断。记得要提前用冷水泡1015分钟 1锅烧热加少量油，小火煸炒葱段蒜末和干辣椒 煸出香味后倒入处理好的虾仁 虾仁炒成红色就倒入洋葱胡萝卜和青椒丝一起煸炒几分钟。 蔬菜稍微炒软就加入火腿肠，再加少量盐和咖喱粉打个底味。炒蔬菜的时候可以稍微点一点热水更好熟 蔬菜基本都熟了就把事先泡好并沥去水分的粉丝倒入锅中一起炒，炒粉的时候沿着锅四周加入适量的油防止粘锅 粉丝炒23分钟就好，之后就可以开始调味了，先加入适量蚝油 根据自己的口味加适量的盐 最后加稍微多一点的咖喱粉 完成 黄灿灿的看着就好吃
references: Title: Singapore Noodles, Ingredients: 1 lb ground pork (or beef or poultry) 5 garlic cloves, minced 3 teaspoons ground ginger 1/4 teaspoon cayenne 1 1/2 tablespoons curry powder 1/3 cup green onion, slivered (or chopped) 1/4 cup oyster sauce 2 teaspoons soy sauce 1 lb spaghetti, Steps: In a wok or large frying pan, scramble-fry pork with garlic, ginger, cayenne, curry, and green onion. Meanwhile, cook spaghetti according to package instructions. Add oyster sauce and soy sauce to meat mixture and toss well to mix thoroughly. Drain spaghetti and add to meat. Toss to mix and serve.

Title: Singaporean Fried Rice Noodles

Ingredients:
- 3 rolls of Singaporean rice noodles (specifically for stir-frying)
- 15-20 fresh shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1/2 large onion, thinly sliced
- 1 small carrot, julienned
- 3-5 green bell peppers, thinly sliced
- 1 large sausage (ham or similar), thinly sliced
- Minced garlic, sliced green onions, and dried red chili peppers, to taste
- Curry powder, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Cooking oil, as needed
- Oyster sauce, to taste

Instructions:
1. Soak the rice noodles in cold water for 10-15 minutes, then drain well. Set aside.
2. Heat a small amount of oil in a large pan or wok over low heat. Add the sliced green onions, minced garlic, and dried red chili peppers. Stir-fry until fragrant.
3. Add the shrimp to the pan and cook until they turn pink.
4. Add the sliced onion, julienned carrot, and sliced green bell peppers to the pan. Stir-fry for a few minutes until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Add the sliced sausage, a pinch of salt, and a small amount of curry powder to the pan. Stir well to combine. If needed, add a little hot water to help cook the vegetables.
6. Once the vegetables are mostly cooked, add the soaked and drained rice noodles to the pan. Stir-fry together, adding oil around the edges of the pan to prevent sticking.
7. Cook the noodles for 2-3 minutes, then begin seasoning. Add oyster sauce and salt to taste.
8. Finish by adding a generous amount of curry powder, stirring well to combine.
9. Serve the Singaporean Fried Rice Noodles hot and enjoy the delicious golden dish!

Title: Corn and Egg Custard

Ingredients:
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup of hot water
- 1/2 cup of corn kernels (fresh or canned)
- 1/4 cup of diced ham or bacon
- 1/2 teaspoon of salt

Instructions:
1. Crack the eggs into a shallow bowl or container.
2. Whisk the eggs in one direction until they become a smooth liquid.
3. Add the hot water to the egg mixture, maintaining a 1:2 ratio of egg to water. Add the salt and continue whisking in the same direction until well combined.

5. Cover the container with plastic wrap, leaving a small opening for steam to escape.
6. Place the container in a steamer and steam for approximately 10 minutes. Make sure the steamer lid is not tightly sealed, leaving a small gap for steam to escape.
7. Carefully remove the container from the steamer and serve the corn and egg custard immediately. Enjoy!

source: Title: 扬州炒饭, Ingredients: 半根胡萝卜 两个鸡蛋 半根黄瓜 小半个紫皮圆葱 半根秋林红肠, Steps: 紫皮圆葱、黄瓜、红肠切小丁，胡萝卜切沫，备用 鸡蛋打散，用筷子高速搅打几下至出沫，下油锅炒散，盛出来，备用。炒的时候趁蛋液未凝固快速翻动锅铲，这样炒出来的蛋比较散。 起锅另放油，放入圆葱小火煸至圆葱酥黄，葱香四溢，加入胡萝卜和黄瓜丁翻炒，炒至黄瓜变色呈透明状，即可加入米饭。 待米饭炒匀，加入红肠和炒好的鸡蛋，翻炒几下，加盐调味即可出锅。小馋孩一口气吃了满满两碗，彻底打乱了我让他减肥的计划
references: Title: Yang Chow Fried Rice, Ingredients: 2 tablespoons canola oil, divided 4 large eggs, lightly beaten and divided 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, divided Dash of salt 1 3/4 cups thinly sliced green onions, divided 2 teaspoons grated peeled fresh ginger 2 garlic cloves, minced 5 cups cooked short-grain rice, chilled 1/4 cup lower-sodium soy sauce {Check for Gluten} 1/2 teaspoon salt 1 (10-ounce) package frozen green peas, thawed 3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, Steps: Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add half of eggs; swirl to coat bottom of pan evenly. Sprinkle with 1/8 teaspoon pepper and dash of salt; cook 3 minutes or until egg is done. Remove egg from pan; thinly slice, and set aside. Wipe pan clean with a paper towel. Heat remaining 4 teaspoons oil in pan over medium-high heat. Add 1 cup onions, ginger, and garlic; stir-fry 30 seconds. Add remaining eggs and rice; stir-fry 3 minutes. Stir in half of reserved egg strips, remaining 3/4 cup onions, remaining 1/8 teaspoon pepper, soy sauce, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and peas; cook 30 seconds, stirring well to combine. Top with remaining egg strips and cilantro. Chilling the cooked rice is the key to making delicious fried rice. Allowing the rice to chill overnight (or at least for a few hours) helps eliminate excess moisture, keeping the grains firm and separate. If you use hot, freshly cooked rice, you're likely to end up with mushier results.

source: Title: 皮蛋瘦肉粥, Ingredients: 适量大米 适量瘦肉 适量皮蛋 适量姜 适量葱 适量胡椒粉, Steps: 大米洗净，用保鲜袋放在冰箱冷冻层。冷冻2小时以上，也可提前一晚放入，第二天早上取出。 猪肉切成丝，用盐、胡椒粉、食用油、淀粉搅拌均匀，用保鲜袋放入冰箱冷藏层，冷藏时长和大米一致。 皮蛋切块，姜切片。用保鲜袋放入冰箱冷藏层，冷藏时长与大米一致。 锅中沸水，放入冷冻的大米，熬制10分钟后，放入姜片，逐条放入肉丝，搅拌均匀后，再放入皮蛋，继续搅拌2分钟左右，即可出锅。盛入碗中后，可放入少许葱花。
references: Title: Congee, Ingredients: 5 cups chicken stock 5 cups water 1 cup white rice 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar 2 tablespoons fish sauce 1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger 1 teaspoon salt 1/4 teaspoon sesame oil 2 (6 ounce) fillets lean white fish, sliced 1/4 cup pickled Chinese vegetables 1/4 cup sliced Chinese roast pork 2 tablespoons chopped scallions 2 tablespoons crushed peanuts 1/2 teaspoon vinegar, or to taste 1/2 teaspoon soy sauce, or to taste, Steps: Combine chicken stock, water, rice, 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar, fish sauce, ginger, salt, and sesame oil in a large stockpot; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until congee has thickened to the consistency of a light porridge, about 3 hours. Stir fish into congee and simmer until cooked through, about 10 minutes. Serve congee in bowls topped with pickled vegetables, roast pork, scallions, and peanuts. Drizzle 1/2 teaspoon vinegar and soy sauce over toppings.

Title: Century Egg and Lean Pork Congee

Ingredients:
- 1 cup of rice
- 8 oz lean pork
- 2 century eggs
- 1-inch piece of ginger
- 2 green onions
- Salt and pepper, to taste

Instructions:
1. Rinse the rice thoroughly and place it in a resealable plastic bag. Store the bag in the freezer for at least 2 hours, or overnight for best results.

2. Slice the lean pork into thin strips. In a mixing bowl, combine the pork with a pinch of salt, pepper, a drizzle of cooking oil, and a teaspoon of cornstarch. Mix well and place the mixture in a resealable plastic bag. Store the bag in the refrigerator for the same duration as the rice.

3. Cut the century eggs into small pieces and slice the ginger. Place them in a resealable plastic bag and store in the refrigerator for the same duration as the rice.

4. Bring a pot of water to a boil and add the frozen rice. Cook for 10 minutes, then add the ginger slices.

5. Gradually add the pork strips to the pot, stirring constantly to ensure even cooking. After the pork is well incorporated, add the century egg pieces and continue stirring for another 2 minutes.

6. Remove the congee from heat and transfer it to serving bowls. Garnish with chopped green onions and serve hot. Enjoy your Century Egg and Lean Pork Congee!

source: Title: 鸡丝凉面, Ingredients: 1只鸡腿 1条黄瓜 3两鲜手工面 适量辣椒油 适量麻酱 适量姜蒜泥 少许糖 适量酱油 适量醋 少许花椒油 少许葱花 适量葱段 适量生姜 少许料酒 少许八角 适量油, Steps: 鸡腿退冰洗净，在冷锅中放入少许料酒，八角、生姜、葱段，加适量水，大火烧开后转中小火炖煮20分钟后将鸡腿捞出，放凉后手撕成鸡丝备用。 黄瓜切丝。 煮面条：在锅中加入少许盐，水沸后将面条下入，煮至9分熟沥水捞起，过凉水可饮用的纯净水，加入适量的油将面条拌匀，用风扇吹凉会摊开晾凉。 调味：底部码上黄瓜丝，放入适量面条和鸡丝，辣椒油视个人吃辣程度添加，淋上少许麻酱，加入适量姜蒜泥、酱油、醋，少许糖和香油，搅拌均匀即可食用。

- 200g beef (sirloin or flank steak)
- 1 large scallion
- 2 cloves of garlic

- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce

Instructions:

5. Add the scallion strips to the wok and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes.

7. Remove from heat and transfer the stir-fried beef with scallions to a serving plate. Enjoy with steamed rice or noodles.

source: Title: 麻婆豆腐, Ingredients: 1块豆腐 100g肉馅 3根蒜苗 1勺豆豉 2大勺郫县豆瓣 1勺油辣子 适量淀粉 少许生抽 少许料酒 1小撮白糖 少许花椒粉, Steps: 肉馅加少许生抽，少许淀粉搅拌均匀。热锅凉油倒入肉馅，迅速炒散，小火炒干水气，倒入少许开水继续炒干点，起锅备用。 豆腐切成小块，放入开水锅，舀入少许盐焯水，水开后煮两分钟，沥水盛入盘中待用。 热锅热油，倒入郫县豆瓣酱，小火炒出红油，大约用时1分钟，舀入油辣子，再倒入事先剁碎的豆豉，继续炒香，30秒，加入开水熬1分钟。 倒入豆腐块，煮大约两分钟，其间推动豆腐，使其与汤汁融合，后放入蒜苗段，蒜苗段事先切好，蒜苗头斜切，蒜苗叶直切，都切成2厘米长。 再加入之前炒的肉绍，轻轻地推动锅里的材料，可以尝尝咸淡，酌情增添盐。倒入1勺料酒在锅里，放一点点白糖提鲜只要一点点，尝不出甜味 最后勾薄芡，烧一分把钟就大功告成了。 上桌前撒点花椒面在豆腐上。

Title: Mapo Tofu

Ingredients:
- 1 block of tofu
- 100g ground meat (pork or beef)
- 3 garlic sprouts
- 1 tablespoon fermented black beans
- 2 tablespoons Pixian bean paste
- 1 tablespoon chili oil
- Cornstarch, as needed
- A dash of soy sauce
- A dash of cooking wine
- A pinch of white sugar
- A pinch of Sichuan peppercorn powder
- Salt, to taste

Instructions:

1. In a bowl, mix the ground meat with a dash of soy sauce and a small amount of cornstarch until well combined. Set aside.

2. Heat a wok or large pan with oil, add the ground meat mixture, and quickly stir-fry to break it apart. Cook on low heat until the moisture evaporates. Add a small amount of boiling water and continue to cook until slightly dry. Remove from the wok and set aside.

3. Cut the tofu into small cubes and place them in a pot of boiling water. Add a pinch of salt and blanch the tofu for 2 minutes. Drain the tofu and transfer it to a plate.

4. In the same wok, heat some oil and add the Pixian bean paste. Cook on low heat until the oil turns red, about 1 minute. Add the chili oil and the chopped fermented black beans, and continue to cook for another 30 seconds. Add some boiling water and simmer for 1 minute.

5. Add the tofu cubes to the wok and cook for about 2 minutes, gently stirring to combine with the sauce. Add the chopped garlic sprouts (cut into 2 cm lengths, with the white parts cut diagonally and the green parts cut straight).

6. Add the cooked ground meat back into the wok and gently stir to combine. Taste the dish and adjust the salt as needed. Add a dash of cooking wine and a pinch of white sugar to enhance the flavor (the dish should not taste sweet).

7. Finally, mix a small amount of cornstarch with water to create a slurry and add it to the wok to thicken the sauce. Cook for another minute.

8. Before serving, sprinkle a pinch of Sichuan peppercorn powder over the tofu. Enjoy your Mapo Tofu with steamed rice or noodles.

references: Title: Salt-Baked Chicken, Ingredients: About 4 pounds kosher salt 1 4-pound chicken, Steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. references: Title: Scallion Pancakes , Ingredients: 1 cup vegetable shortening (crisco preferred) 3 cups scallions finely chopped 1 7/8 teaspoons granulated sugar 1 3/4 teaspoons salt 3 cups all purpose flour 8 ounces hot water 8 tablespoons peanut oil for frying, Steps: In a bowl combine shortening scallions salt and sugar. Title: Scallion Pancakes

Ingredients:

Instructions:

8. Coil the rolled pancake into a spiral shape, then flatten and roll it out again into a thin, round pancake.

9. Preheat an electric griddle or non-stick skillet over medium heat and brush it with a thin layer of oil.

Instructions:

5. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for 30 minutes to allow the yeast to activate and the dough to rise.

6. While the dough is resting, prepare your desired char siu (Chinese BBQ pork) filling.

7. After the dough has rested, divide it into equal portions and roll each portion into a smooth ball.

8. Flatten each dough ball and place a spoonful of the char siu filling in the center. Gather the edges of the dough around the filling and pinch them together to seal the bun.

9. Place the filled buns on a parchment-lined steamer tray, leaving enough space between each bun to allow for expansion during cooking.

10. Steam the buns over high heat for 15-20 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the dough is soft and fluffy.

1. In a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine sugar, soy sauce, rose wine, hoisin sauce, oyster sauce, sesame paste, peanut butter, salt, Chinese five-spice powder, minced ginger, and minced garlic. Mix well to create the char siu sauce. Adjust the ingredients according to your personal taste preferences.

2. If using store-bought char siu sauce, skip step 1.

3. Marinate your choice of meat (such as pork or chicken) with the char siu sauce for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight, to allow the flavors to fully penetrate the meat.

4. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C). Place the marinated meat on a baking tray lined with aluminum foil or parchment paper.

5. Bake the meat for 25-30 minutes, or until cooked through and slightly caramelized on the outside. Baste the meat with the remaining char siu sauce halfway through the cooking time for extra flavor.

6. Alternatively, if you do not have an oven, you can steam the marinated meat in a steamer for 20-25 minutes, or until fully cooked.

7. Allow the cooked meat to rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving with your favorite side dishes.

Note: Avoid frying the meat, as the sugar content in the sauce can cause it to burn easily.

Ingredients:

- 2 tablespoons milk powder

Instructions:

1. Place the high-gluten flour in a large mixing bowl.

4. While the dough is rising, prepare the char siu filling. If you have store-bought char siu pork, chop it into small pieces. In a separate bowl, mix the chopped char siu with soy sauce, oyster sauce, and cornstarch until well combined. Set aside.

5. Once the dough has risen, add a little corn oil to prevent it from sticking to your hands. Knead the dough into a long log and sprinkle some dry flour on top.

7. Place a spoonful of the char siu filling in the center of each dough circle. Pinch the edges together to seal the filling inside, creating a fan-like shape.

8. Line a steamer with a piece of cheesecloth or parchment paper and place the buns on top, leaving some space between each bun.

9. Fill a pot with cold water and place the steamer on top. Steam the buns over medium heat for about 12 minutes, or until they have expanded and are cooked through.

10. Carefully remove the buns from the steamer and enjoy your delicious homemade Char Siu Bao!

Instructions:

- 1 tablespoon soy sauce (preferably a rich and flavorful one like "Wei Ji Xian" soy sauce)
- 1 tablespoon oyster sauce
- 3 lemon slices, thinly sliced
- 3 garlic cloves, thinly sliced
- Honey, for brushing (amount to taste)
- Ground black pepper, to taste (optional)

Instructions:
1. Make three cuts on each chicken wing to allow for better flavor absorption and even cooking.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine the soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sliced garlic. Marinate the chicken wings in this mixture for 1 hour.
3. Preheat your oven to 200°C (392°F). Place the marinated chicken wings on a baking tray and top each wing with a thin slice of lemon.
4. Bake the chicken wings for 20 minutes. Remove the tray from the oven and brush the surface of each wing with honey. If desired, sprinkle some ground black pepper on top.
5. Return the tray to the oven and bake for an additional 3 minutes, allowing the honey to caramelize and the wings to develop a beautiful color.

source: Title: 珍珠丸子, Ingredients: 250克直接用绞肉也可以夹子肉盖板肉、五花肉都可以 2朵泡发干香菇 20克胡萝卜 3个去皮荸荠 2瓣蒜 5克姜 14茶匙胡椒粉 12茶匙盐 12茶匙糖 10克我用的海天金标生抽生抽 10克葱花 10克淀粉 一小把枸杞 150克请泡一小时以上，再沥干水份干糯米, Steps: 三瓣蒜掰掉硬头，放入小美主锅 设置2秒反转5，剥蒜皮 拿掉蒜皮，放入5克姜 2秒速度8，打碎姜蒜，用刮刀将锅壁的刮到锅底 放入三个去皮的荸荠、20克胡萝卜、2朵泡发好的干香菇挤干水分 设置3秒速度6打碎 清空主锅如果准备的已经绞好的绞肉就不需要清空主锅 绞250克肉末，如果买的肉馅就忽略，正确绞肉的方法参考我下厨房的方子链接httpswwwxiachufangcomrecipe104190109groupsharetitlea 250克绞肉、之前切好的胡萝卜荸荠香菇碎、14茶匙胡椒粉、12茶匙盐、12茶匙糖、10克生抽我用的海天金标生抽、10克淀粉提前用少许水化开、10克葱花全部放入主锅。 1分钟反转速度3，上劲 做成小丸子，滚上糯米，放入小美蒸锅组如果主锅是一大锅汤可以在下层铺烘培纸，如果不是请忽略烘培纸 开水上锅蒸25分钟，或者600克冷水上锅蒸30分钟左右，根据丸子的大小适当调整时间。蒸丸子时，取和丸子同样数量的枸杞，用温水泡软，丸子快结束前沥干泡好的枸杞。 蒸好请把蒸笼取下来，每个丸子顶部放上枸杞点缀一下。 趁热享用。
references: Title: Pearl Balls, Ingredients: 300 grams Minced pork 2 tablespoons water 1/2 teaspoon of salt 2 tablespoons coriander (cilantro) stalks, chopped 1 tablespoon sliced spring onions 1 teaspoon of grated fresh ginger Black pepper 1 cup glutinous rice 1 tablespoon cornstarch, Steps: Rinse the rice until the water runs clear and then soak for an hour. Remove, rinse and drain in a sieve. Spread the rice on a flat plate and pat with a paper towel to remove the excess water. Mix the pork with the water, wine, coriander, ginger, onions, salt and pepper and mix well to combine . Add the cornstarch and then mix. That's your filling all done. Using a teaspoon dipped in water, scoop up spoonfuls and roll into balls. When your meat balls are ready, roll them in the rice till they are completely coated. Prepare a steamer by lining with a damp cloth. Place the pearl balls in, about 2 cm apart Steam over high heat for half and hour Remove and serve. I served mine with a passata made with ginger and coriander, though the chinese typically serve them with soy sauce.

Title: Pearl Meatballs

Ingredients:
- 250g ground meat (pork, beef, or a mix)
- 2 dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked and drained
- 20g carrot
- 3 peeled water chestnuts
- 2 garlic cloves
- 5g ginger
- 1/4 tsp ground black pepper
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/2 tsp sugar
- 10g soy sauce (preferably Haitian Gold Label Soy Sauce)
- 10g chopped green onions
- 10g cornstarch, mixed with a little water
- A small handful of dried goji berries
- 150g glutinous rice, soaked for at least 1 hour and drained

Instructions:
1. Peel the garlic cloves and place them in a food processor. Add the ginger and process for 2 seconds at high speed to chop them finely. Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a spatula.
2. Add the peeled water chestnuts, carrot, and soaked shiitake mushrooms to the food processor. Process for 3 seconds at medium speed to chop them finely.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground meat, chopped vegetables, black pepper, salt, sugar, soy sauce, cornstarch mixture, and chopped green onions. Mix well for 1 minute until the mixture is well combined and sticky.
4. Form the mixture into small meatballs. Roll each meatball in the soaked and drained glutinous rice to coat them evenly.
5. Place the meatballs in a steamer basket lined with parchment paper (if using a large pot of soup, otherwise skip the parchment paper). Steam the meatballs over boiling water for 25 minutes, or over 600g of cold water for about 30 minutes. Adjust the steaming time according to the size of the meatballs.
6. While the meatballs are steaming, soak the goji berries in warm water. Drain them just before the meatballs are done.
7. Remove the steamer basket from the heat. Place a goji berry on top of each meatball as a garnish.
8. Serve the pearl meatballs hot and enjoy!

source: Title: 红烧牛肉面, Ingredients: 500克牛肉 5-10个辣椒 1tbsp青花椒 3个八角 5片姜 2块桂皮 2tbsp豆瓣酱 3tbs酱油 1个洋葱 1tsp盐 3杯面粉 1杯水, Steps: 牛肉焯水撇去浮沫，用温热水将捞出的牛肉清洗干净，放在一旁待用 将干辣椒剪成小段放在碗里，用凉水泡半个小时，待干辣椒吸水舒展后，将液体滤掉，辣椒放在一旁待用 在炖锅中加油，小火煸炒辣椒和青花椒，4-5分钟后加入洋葱碎继续煸炒，直到洋葱呈半透明状，此时加入焯水后干净的牛肉，随后加入热水没过牛肉 此时，往锅里加入八角，桂皮，姜片，酱油，盐，和豆瓣酱，盖上锅盖，中大火待国内沸腾后转小火，煮两个小时 炖牛肉的同时开始和面，中筋面粉和水的比例31揉成面团状，盖上保鲜膜醒20分钟后，将面团擀成饼状，双面涂油后用保鲜膜覆盖放置一个半小时，面饼充分吸收油脂后回非常有弹性 一个半小时后，将面饼切成若干条状，双手轻轻一拉就能均匀拉长，随即放入沸腾锅煮面，过程中记得浇两次凉水使面熟的透彻 捞出面，炖锅里的牛肉也差不多了，汤勺捞出一勺牛肉一勺汤就可以开饭了。祝大家enjoy。

Title: Braised Beef Noodle Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 lb (500g) beef, cut into chunks
- 5-10 dried red chili peppers
- 1 tbsp Sichuan peppercorns
- 3 star anise
- 5 slices of ginger
- 2 cinnamon sticks
- 2 tbsp doubanjiang (fermented bean paste)
- 3 tbsp soy sauce
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 tsp salt
- 3 cups (375g) all-purpose flour
- 1 cup (240ml) water

Instructions:

1. Blanch the beef in boiling water for a few minutes to remove impurities. Remove the beef from the water, rinse with warm water, and set aside.

2. Cut the dried chili peppers into small pieces and place them in a bowl. Soak the chili peppers in cold water for 30 minutes. Once the chili peppers have softened, drain the water and set them aside.

3. In a large pot, heat some oil over low heat. Add the chili peppers and Sichuan peppercorns, and cook for 4-5 minutes. Add the chopped onion and continue to cook until the onion becomes translucent. Add the blanched beef to the pot, followed by enough hot water to cover the beef.

4. Add the star anise, cinnamon sticks, ginger slices, soy sauce, salt, and doubanjiang to the pot. Cover with a lid and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and simmer for 2 hours.

5. While the beef is simmering, prepare the noodles. Combine the flour and water in a mixing bowl, and knead until a dough forms. Cover the dough with plastic wrap and let it rest for 20 minutes. Roll out the dough into a thin, flat circle. Brush both sides of the dough with oil, cover with plastic wrap, and let it rest for another 30 minutes. The dough should become very elastic.

6. After 30 minutes, cut the dough into thin strips. Gently stretch the strips with your hands to elongate them. Bring a pot of water to a boil and cook the noodles until they are cooked through, adding cold water to the pot twice during the cooking process.

7. Drain the noodles and place them in serving bowls. By this time, the beef should be tender. Ladle some beef and broth over the noodles and serve. Enjoy your Braised Beef Noodle Soup!

source: Title: 肥牛饭, Ingredients: 半斤肥牛 若干西兰花 半瓶矿泉水水 1勺蚝油 1碗米饭 2勺白糖 1勺料酒 1勺盐 2勺生抽 半颗洋葱 1根胡萝卜, Steps: 西蓝花和胡萝卜抄熟备用，肥牛用沸水快速抄一下变色即出，洋葱切丝备用，勾兑调料汁一勺盐，两勺糖，两勺生抽，一勺耗油，两勺淀粉，半瓶矿泉水，一点点黄油，一点点白胡椒粉。 平底锅烧热加底油洋葱下锅炒软迅速加入肥牛快速翻炒，加入勾兑汤汁翻炒均匀关火。 碗中把米饭打底，铺上西蓝花和胡萝卜，加入炒好的洋葱肥牛，淋上汤汁。 出锅，赛过吉野家的招牌牛肉饭。如果用日本酱油代替生抽更好味道。

Title: Lion's Head Meatballs

Ingredients:

- 4 dried matsutake mushrooms (松茸)

Instructions:

3. Add the chopped scallops, mushrooms, and abalone to the pork mixture. Mix until well combined.

4. Shape the mixture into large meatballs, about the size of a golf ball.

5. Heat a generous amount of vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Fry the meatballs until they are golden brown on all sides. Remove from the pan and set aside.

7. Serve the Lion's Head Meatballs with steamed rice or noodles. Enjoy!

Instructions:

3. Remove the lamb from the pot and rinse it with warm water. Set aside to cool and dry. Reserve the lamb broth for cooking the rice.

4. Peel and julienne the carrots. Thinly slice the onion.

7. Add the julienned carrots and 3 tablespoons of the reserved lamb broth. Cook until the liquid has reduced and a light orange sauce forms. Add the remaining salt and remove from heat.

6. In a small bowl, mix the potato starch with a little water to create a slurry. Add the slurry to the pot, stirring well to combine.
7. Season the soup with salt and chicken bouillon powder to taste.
8. Slowly pour the beaten egg into the soup, stirring gently to create egg ribbons. Once the egg has cooked and is floating in the soup, turn off the heat.
9. Drizzle a few drops of sesame oil into the soup and sprinkle the chopped green onions on top.
10. Serve the soup immediately. Enjoy!

references: Title: Chicken Dumpling Soup, Ingredients: stewing chicken 1 sm., or hen 2 onions diced 1 parsley root cream in color, carrot-like 6 carrots 3 stalks celery 2 bunches fresh parsley diced 1/2 cup water 1/2 cup milk 2 eggs salt flour, Steps: Cut up chicken (hen) into parts and rinse well. Title: Spicy Beef Noodle Soup

Ingredients:
- 2 lbs beef brisket
- 3 tomatoes
- A handful of green onions, ginger, and garlic
- A pinch of Sichuan peppercorns
- 1 black cardamom pod
- 1 star anise
- 1 small cinnamon stick
- 1 tablespoon Pixian Doubanjiang (broad bean paste)
- 2 tablespoons tomato ketchup
- A small handful of rock sugar
- A few splashes of dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, and Chinese cooking wine

Instructions:
1. Cut the beef brisket into chunks and blanch in boiling water to remove impurities. Drain and set aside, reserving the broth for later use.

2. In a separate pot, heat some oil and add the green onions, ginger, garlic, star anise, Sichuan peppercorns, and black cardamom. Stir-fry until fragrant. Then, add the Pixian Doubanjiang and continue to stir-fry until the oil turns red.

3. Add the beef chunks to the pot and stir-fry until slightly browned. Add the dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, and Chinese cooking wine, stirring to coat the beef evenly.

4. Add the chopped tomatoes, tomato ketchup, and rock sugar to the pot, stirring to combine. Pour in the reserved beef broth and transfer everything to a pressure cooker. Cook on low heat for 40 minutes.

5. After the pressure has released, open the lid and season with salt. Cook on high heat to reduce the sauce to your desired consistency. If serving with noodles, leave a bit more broth in the pot.

6. To serve, cook your choice of noodles according to package instructions. In a serving bowl, ladle some beef soup over the cooked noodles. Add a spoonful of the beef and sauce, and garnish with your choice of vegetables or cilantro. Enjoy!
